Description: The Justice Department reached a settlement resolving allegations that Compass Bank of Birmingham, Ala., engaged in a pattern of lending discrimination against individuals based on their marital status.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Company: National City Bank and its successor PNC Bank
Description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Department of Justice filed a joint complaint against National City Bank for charging higher prices on mortgage loans to African-American and Hispanic borrowers than similarly creditworthy white borrowers between the years 2002 and 2008. The agencies also filed a proposed order to settle the complaint that required National City Bank, through its successor PNC Bank, to pay $35 million in restitution to harmed African-American and Hispanic borrowers.

Company: National City Corporation d/b/a National City Bank
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: National City Mortgage Inc. agreed to pay the United States $4.6 million to settle allegations arising under the False Claims Act concerning 58 federally insured loans for mortgages submitted to the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

Description: PNC Bank N.A. agreed to pay $7.1 million to settle claims under the False Claims Act that it failed to engage in prudent underwriting practices in connection with the issuance of loans guaranteed by the Small Business Administration.

Ten mortgage servicing companies subject to enforcement actions for deficient practices in mortgage loan servicing and foreclosure processing reached an agreement in principle with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency and the Federal Reserve Board to pay more than $8.5 billion in cash payments and other assistance to help borrowers.
Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Description: civil money penalty
Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Description: PNC ICLC Corp., a subsidiary of the PNC Financial Services Group, Inc., agreed to pay $90 million to a restitution fund and $25 million in penalties to the United States as part of a deferred prosecution agreement on criminal charges of conspiracy to violate securities laws.

The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development reached an Agreement with PNC Mortgage in Trumbull, CT settling allegations that the lender violated the Fair Housing Act by requiring a home loan applicant on paid maternity leave to return to work before the lender would approve a home loan.

Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Description: PNC Bank N.A. agreed to pay the United States $9.5 million to settle claims under the False Claims Act in connection with the issuance of loans guaranteed by the U.S. Small Business Administration.

Riggs Bank pleaded guilty to a federal criminal violation of the Bank Secrecy Act in connection with what was said to be Riggs' repeated and systemic failure accurately to report suspicious monetary transactions associated with bank accounts owned and controlled by Augusto Pinochet of Chile and by the government of Equatorial Guinea.

Info Source: Contained in data obtained on August 17, 2017 in response to an open records request.

Description: The settlement amount here refers only to the ERISA portion of a larger case.
Private Litigation Case Title: In re National City Corp. Securities, Derivative And Employee Retirement Income Security Act (Erisa) Litigation

Company: National City Commercial Capital Company LLC
Description: National City Commercial Capital agreed to issue refunds or reduce the debt of 381 former NorVergence customers nationwide as part of a $7.2 million agreement reached today with 22 states.

The New York Attorney General announced settlements with seven financial institutions in connection with a widespread telecommunications fraud involving NorVergence, Inc., a bankrupt New Jersey-based telephone equipment and service company.
Agreed to pay $5,000 in settlement of alleged violations of the No-Call Act.
swaps reporting violation

Private Litigation Case Title: Herbin et al v. The PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. et al

Description: The Department of Justice's U.S. Trustee Program entered into national agreements with three mortgage servicers to address past mortgage servicing deficiencies impacting homeowners in bankruptcy.
The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority fined 12 firms for significant deficiencies relating to the preservation of broker-dealer and customer records in a format that prevents alteration.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.

Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority fined five bank broker-dealers a total of $1.65 million for deficient supervision and procedures related to variable annuity (VA), mutual fund or unit investment trust (UIT) transactions.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.
